'Twas when the slow-declining ray</br>Had ting'd the cloud with evening gold;</br>No warbler pour'd the melting lay,</br>No sound disturb'd the peeping fold.
When by a murmuring rill reclin'd</br>Sat wrapt in thought a wandering swain;</br>Calm Peace compos'd his musing mind;</br>And thus he rais'd the flowing strain.
"Hail Innocence!  celestial maid!</br>What joys thy blushing charms reveal!</br>Sweet, as the arbour's cooling shade,</br>And milder than the vernal gale.
On Thee attends a radiant Quire,</br>Soft-smiling Peace, and downy Rest;</br>With Love that prompts the warbling Lyre,</br>And Hope that soothes the throbbing breast.
O sent from heav'n to haunt the grove,</br>Where squinting Envy ne'er can come!</br>Nor pines the cheek with luckless love,</br>Nor Anguish chills the living bloom.
But spotless Beauty rob'd in white</br>Sits on yon moss-grown hill reclin'd;</br>Serene as heav'n's unsully'd light,</br>And pure as Delia's gentle mind.
Grant, heavn'ly power!  thy peaceful sway</br>May still my ruder thoughts controul;</br>Thy hand to point my dubious way,</br>Thy voice to soothe the melting soul.
Far in the shady sweet retreat</br>Let Thought beguile the lingering hour;</br>Let Quiet court the mossy seat,</br>And twining olives form the bower.
Let dove-ey'd Peace her wreath bestow,</br>And oft' sit listening in the dale,</br>While Night's sweet warbler from the bough</br>Tells to the grove her plaintive tale.
Soft as in Delia's snowy breast,</br>Let each consenting passion move;</br>Let Angels watch its silent rest,</br>And all its blissful dreams be Love."</br>
